question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Loop counter wraparound] Can the loop counter at line 88 ('while k < n') wrap around if k overflows, causing an infinite loop that hangs validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g1] [Duplication divergence] Since serial_fft_assign_g1 duplicates serial_fft_assign logic (line 108 TODO), can bug fixes applied to one but not the other create inconsistent behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g2] [Duplication maintenance] Can the duplicated bitreverse function in serial_fft_assign_g2 (lines 157-163) diverge from other implementations causing G2 FFT to use different bit-reversal logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All serial_fft_assign variants] [Algorithmic inconsistency] If one serial_fft_assign variant is updated with optimizations, can the others remain unoptimized causing performance inconsistencies across Scalar/G1/G2 operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: ifft_assign_g1/g2] [IFFT duplication] Can differences in how ifft_assign, ifft_assign_g1, and ifft_assign_g2 handle edge cases lead to inconsistent inverse transform behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: fft_assign] [Empty polynomial] If poly is empty and dom.N > 0, does the resize at line 17 correctly create a zero polynomial, or can it cause issues with the FFT algorithm? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Single element FFT] When n=1 and log_n=0, does the FFT algorithm correctly handle the trivial case without entering the butterfly loops? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Maximum size FFT] For the largest supported log_n value, does the FFT complete without overflow in intermediate calculations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All IFFT functions] [Zero polynomial] When applying IFFT to a zero polynomial, do lines 38-40, 47-49, 56-58 correctly preserve zeros without introducing numerical errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: fft] [Mismatched sizes] If poly.len() > dom.N, can the copy_from_slice at line 27 panic or silently truncate data causing incorrect FFT results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: fft_assign] [DFT correctness] Does the FFT implementation produce bit-accurate results matching the mathematical DFT definition, or can small errors break polynomial commitment soundness? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: ifft_assign] [Inverse correctness] Is the IFFT mathematically the exact inverse of FFT, or can accumulated field arithmetic errors cause decrypt/verification failures in cryptographic protocols? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All FFT functions] [Determinism] Do FFT operations produce identical results across different hardware/OS platforms, ensuring consensus validators compute the same cryptographic values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g1] [G1 commitment security] Can incorrect FFT results in G1 break the binding property of polynomial commitments used in zero-knowledge proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign_g2] [G2 verification security] Can errors in G2 FFT break the soundness of pairing-based verification equations in BLS signature aggregation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All FFT functions] [Root of unity security] If omega is not a primitive N-th root of unity, can the FFT produce colliding evaluations that break cryptographic uniqueness guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Algorithmic complexity] For extremely large log_n values, can the O(n log n) FFT complexity still cause validator timeouts during consensus operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: fft_assign] [Repeated resizing] If fft_assign is called repeatedly with varying polynomial sizes, can frequent reallocation cause memory fragmentation degrading validator performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: ifft_assign_g2] [G2 performance bottleneck] Can an attacker force validators to perform many IFFT operations on large G2 point arrays to create computational DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Cache thrashing] Can the memory access pattern in FFT butterfly operations cause CPU cache thrashing for large arrays, degrading validator cryptographic throughput? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Zero scalar handling] When twiddle factors become zero (which shouldn't happen with correct omega), do lines 92-98 handle it without causing field division errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: serial_fft_assign] [Field overflow] Can the add_assign and sub_assign operations at lines 95-97 cause field element overflow, or is modular reduction correctly applied? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: ifft_assign] [Inverse multiplication] When multiplying by N_inverse at line 39, can the result ever be outside the valid field element range? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: All FFT functions] [Field characteristic] Does the FFT algorithm assume specific properties about the BLS12-381 scalar field characteristic, and can changes to the underlying curve break these assumptions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/blstrs/fft.rs] [Function: fft_assign] [Mutable reference safety] While fft_assign takes &mut Vec, can concurrent calls on cloned vectors cause data races if they share underlying capacity allocations? (Low)
